comment: This professor was not good at all. She took the last week of the semester to grade anything. We rarely had assignments, her classes were boring bc she just read off slides and that's it. She was snappy to me in email and accused me of things for an assignment and when I explained what actually happened I got ignored. Never taking this lady again

This professor does not give many assignments throughout the semester. While that may seem like a good thing, she takes the entire semester to grade, meaning you will not know your overall performance in the class at any point in the semester until the last day. Other than that, the assignments that are given are not challenging in nature.

Final grades are due next week and I have NO idea what my grade could possibly be in this class due to more than half of my things being ungraded. There are only four projects with quizzes that go with each, so it would've been nice to know my grade at least a week or two after I submitted to know if I needed to improve on something. Don't take…

Professor Riner is passionate about her teaching and shows she cares for her students. Attendance is mandatory if you want extra credit. Her lectures are hard to follow, but she has lots of personal stories so be prepared. She barely mentions her quizzes or tells us what's on the final exam. There's group work, chapter quizzes, and a paper too.

She was very unclear throughout the semester. Final grades are due next week, and she has yet to put in half of our grades, so I am not even sure what my grade is in the class. She sometimes forgot to post assignments on D2L, making us rush on the assignment. Groupwork throughout the semester, even if it is online. Online > in person for her.
I wouldn't recommend. She's a good person but awful professor. Submits grades at the very last minute and is a tough grade. This course should've been an easy A but instead she made it difficult

Second time having her and only take her if desperate. Only put in grades towards the end of the semester, grading criteria are also all over the place, quizzes don't make sense to the readings, and assignments don't make sense to the class. She is a nice person but a terrible professor. She is also a bit passive-aggressive toward students IYKYK.

she is very unorganized. alot of this assignments werent in d2l and we had to email to remind her as if she didnt create the course calendar. she also takes forever to put in grades. the assignments were also unclear and lengthy at times. i would take again simply because it was very hands off if you get what i mean

Very unorganized. Do not take her online because she will forget to post assignments on D2L and by the time she does you have like 5 days to complete the assignment. She seems nice and replies fast to emails. Group work papers, small writing assignments. Not hard at all, wis. h I took his in-person

Instructions are all over the place and not clear with assignments. I took her class over the summer, which makes it worse because the course moves so fast during this time. She isn't clear with assignments and is very passive-aggressive. DO NOT take this class unless you want to be confused the whole time.

Honestly wouldn't recommend this professor, especially if taking online during the summer. She seems passive aggressive and doesn't answer questions well. Her syllabus and actual due dates don't match. The work isn't that hard but she is a tough grader. I usually don't feel comfortable asking her questions. Very unclear Take her at your own risk!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Don't take this professor if you want your assignments graded on time. This class is a capstone needed for graduation. I haven't had anything graded in 3 months.

This class was easy but in the most confusing way possible, she did not give clear instructions during class and was extremely condescending when students asked questions. We had one big project we worked on the whole semester and didn't receive any grades for it until the end of the semester, leaving a lot of students confused about their progress
By far the best Professor at KSU ! She cares about each and everyone of her students and will help you with plans for post grad .
Class decided to come here and give our honest opinion on her, her ratings from her first year are so far from who she is and how she teaches. 10/10 recommend her.

Dr. Riner improved from her first year at KSU. She's so supportive and an incredible professor. 100% recommend her as a professor and a mentor. Our class all decided to all rate her on here because her low ratings are so false.
Great course. Would definitely take it again with her, also took her for Healthcare Innovations and Capstone too. Best choice I made at KSU
Best professor I have taken at KSU, easily. Her bad ratings were from her first semester and was an online course. She is truly a professor who will support me after I graduate.

By far the most caring, incredible professor I have ever had in my KSU career. Has supported me in and out of class. She does so much to help us outside of content, like finding potential job listings for us. Easy course if you follow her instructions. Highly recommend. Bad reviews before were from her first semester, she's incredible.

Professor Riner definitely improved from her first year at KSU. Shes undoubtedly very caring, supportive, and a great teacher. Her upper level classes are also a lot more interesting and engaging than IHS2100. I definitely recommend her as not only a professor but also a mentor as you navigate through your IHS degree. 10/10 solid professor.

She grades incredibly hard. One discussion post per model with two replies that need to be spread out. I would reply with over 24 hours in between and still get a lower grade for not spreading them out. Her assignments don't include enough instructions and she is very specific. Nice person, but one of the worse professors I've had.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: By far, one of the worst professors I have ever taken out of my 3 years at Kennesaw state. The lack of communication & misleading instructions for this to be 100% online class is ridiculous. We are at the end of the semester and the last time I received a grade update was September. Shes literally horrible & doesnt need to work at Kennesaw.

I've had my fair share of rough professors at KSU but she was by far the worst. She wanted to fail the whole class on our first test bc she heard some people might be working tghr on homework. Luckily the Dean wouldn't allow her to do this. She didn't teach at all. Wouldn't tell us correct answers on past quizzes. Terrible communication. Very rude

Attendance is mandatory and only worth 2 points/week but honestly her lectures are pointless. She assigns readings from the book and makes PowerPoints for each chapter but doesnt go over either in class. Lectures are mostly about her own life or from a YouTube vid. No study guides even though 1 test was over 13 chpts and every test is different.

Dr. Riner is not exactly the most popular professor within IHS, but she means well and thats more than I can say for many professors. The course was very simple overall but given how much creative control is given to students and how vague she is about expectations, it can seem challenging. Its not.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: 4 tests and theyre worth 60% of grade. if you bomb one, it knocks your grade down a whole letter. lockdown on all tests. does attendance by asking a question at the time class starts and everyone writes their answers on a piece of paper so if youre late you wont hear the question. takes the class too seriously for someone who doesnt teach well.

Her "lectures" are stories about her or youtube videos of people talking about their jobs. Then she tests on degrees and qualifications for EVERY SINGLE JOB. Why do i need to know what degree a psychologist needs if im interested in nursing? She treats this class like its anatomy and physiology. Lockdown browser on all tests.

One word, RUN. By far one of the worst professors at KSU. Attendance is MANDATORY despite learning absolutely nothing in class. Most classes she just talks about herself. Every test is different. She treats her Intro to health science class like its Honors Calculus. Good luck. PLEASE do yourself a favor and pick a different professor if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader
